abstract: A Hamburg regulator said on Tuesday that neither the messenger nor its parent company had received individuals’ permission to share digital information.
snippet: A Hamburg regulator said on Tuesday that neither the messenger nor its parent company had received individuals’ permission to share digital information.
lead_paragraph: When the messaging service WhatsApp announced last month that it was starting to share some of its users’ online information with Facebook, its parent company, many users expressed anger that their digital privacy could be at risk.

headline.main: Facebook Ordered to Stop Collecting Data on WhatsApp Users in Germany
headline.print_headline: German Regulator Orders Facebook to Stop Collecting Data on WhatsApp Users
